intro: Omphalodes nedimeae, commonly known as the Balkan moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue or violet flowers that bloom at night. The plant has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
